tweets.text: @EnvAgencyMids And yet your willing to let the residents including our local trauma hospital, schools and business to be affected daily by the toxic stench from a landfill! About time you started take us serious we are being poisoned dread to think what long term affects this will have

@WaterREast @EnvAgencyMids @AnglianWater @AffinityWater @NFUtweets @LincsWildlife @LincolnshireCC @GreaterLincsLEP @IWA_UK @EnvAgency You need to check the water coming out of Walley’s Quarry run by @RedIndustries2, people complaining of health issues related to this business, heartbreaking we have to live within metres of this badly run site! @stopthestink #stopthestink

We try. Then waste from all over the UK come dumped on our doorsteps and ruins our health. Public Health Crisis in Newcastle Staffs Walleys Landfill. @EnvAgencyMids @BorisJohnson @AaronBell4NUL @ClareDinnisEA https://t.co/ERaX6bD9Jb

tweets.text: @shamytaw @scottdegg @EnvAgencyMids Just on my ward there were 25 women affected by this last night. Sort them out please!

#WorldWaterDay is one of our favourite days next to the day we became independent! 

Today we celebrated with a meeting of the South Lincolnshire Water Partnership discussing collaborative water resource planning in the area.
#collaboration #waterday 🥳💧🥳💧 https://t.co/cTAe0deWnd

England could face #WaterShortages due to #ClimateChange and population growth by 2050.

We're securing future water supplies through our National Framework for Water Resources.

Join us, and help save water: https://t.co/rPYIVLpgjD

#WorldWaterDay #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/rtYjJfzmOH

I would really like to know what @EnvAgency are going to do about @RedIndustries2 Walley’s landfill (mountain) not only does the smell effect us at home if also effects my son at school. It's got to the point now where we can't go the park because of the smell #stopthestink
Tragedy, scandal, public health nightmare @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @AaronBell4NUL @BorisJohnson @Keir_Starmer @DefraGovUK https://t.co/o610WvlBht

tweets.text: Funny how the support staff at @EnvAgency found completely fed up with taking our calls about the vile smell from @redindustries2 Walley’s Quarry landfill. We are fed up too. We are fed up with the EA not doing their job @StinkStopthe #ineptEA #stopthestink #stopmakingussick

@EnvAgencyMids So when are you going to do something about @RedIndustries2 and Walley’s landfill? I can't take my Son's to the park because of the smell making us bad and my eldest doesn't even get a break from it because it stinks at his school

Thank you @EnvAgencyMids I put this in your hands 🤮😷🤧🤕🤒🥵☠💩 How can a waste company Walleys Landfill fall foul in this way? You are the regulator? Why has it come to this? This is a public health scandal @DefraGovUK @BorisJohnson 5.30 am NUL is rotting.

@swlep delighted to have worked with @wiltscouncil and @EnvAgencySW to provide £6m from the Government's Local Growth Fund for this scheme.
@MarcReadCEM @SalisburyCC https://t.co/BU6KpWKVLW

tweets.text: Looking back...this time in 2017 we removed a weir on the Trent at Bucknall Park with partners @EnvAgencyMids and @TrentCaba. The weir was stopping fish from moving through the river. Three years on, this stretch is a much better home for trout, bullhead and other river wildlife. https://t.co/RgEF72fxDy

tweets.text:
#WorldWaterDay 💧 Case study: Great Yarmouth - one of our largest projects for @EnvAgency, we are carrying out major works to renovate and replace flood defences that provide protection to 4,500 homes and businesses. @JBAConsulting 

Read more (p.40) 👉  https://t.co/OFljZymKgh https://t.co/qSqtn0gvWi

It's #WorldWaterDay! 🏊‍♀️
I've celebrated with a swim at Warleigh Weir. We're working with @Sewagefreeswim, @EnvAgency & @wessexwater to make this popular spot a designated bathing water. Find out more about the cause in our new #SewageInOurRivers 💩 report:
https://t.co/3XCVssodQN https://t.co/d9GKXtmbTm

urls.title: Upper Kent | The Flood Hub
urls.description: The Environment Agency is delivering a proposed Flood Risk Management Sc heme to better protect homes and business from flooding in the Kent catchment, and improve the local environment and community amenities. Kendal is the first area to be delivered, followed by Burneside, Staveley, and Ings, and upstream measures including flood storage. In addition, Natural Flood Management measures are being integrated into the plans which aim to slow the flow of water and provide wider environmental benefits across

tweets.text:
Want to know more about the #Kendal flood scheme and the works planned for Burneside, Staveley, Ings and upstream areas? Take a look at the new webpage for phases 2 & 3 here: https://t.co/1OgeSI1PbI

@EnvAgencyNW #Cumbria #floodaware https://t.co/0lNXoLml4M

@EnvAgencyMids Is breaching a permit not illegal? @RedIndustries2 have breached theirs 3 times very recently when are you going to act to protect the people of Newcastle under Lyme! #stopthestink #capitoff

Lots of people passing @CodyDock really distressed at oil once more flowing down tidal river Lea. Been reported (again) to @EnvAgency. There is increased frequency with this - weekly & sometimes more. Birds nesting, reed bed filthy etc. Hard to get good pics! @LDNWaterkeeper https://t.co/2MJJqrU7vc

tweets.text: I hope the government will rise to this challenge by properly funding the @EnvAgency, committing to ending sewage discharges into our rivers, and by not watering down environmental regulations when we so desperately need them.

It's a complex issue, and we much more action from both the Government and national water companies in tackling it.

As I've said time and time again, in this year of @COP26 we should really be making an effort to improve water quality in our rivers and in our oceans.

@robertwoolley @welshharpies @BarnetCouncil @Brent_Council @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @silkstreamers @Thames21 @GoodLawProject So much of this done by local volunteers in tandem with council collections. Monthly litter-picks are organised by the good people at @welshharpies. Maybe, get involved?

@EnvAgencyMids Can I report mismanagement of Walleys Landfill? You already have 1000’s of complaints each month telling you this. What’s the penalty for a minor & a significant breach of @RedIndustries2 permit? Is it a Prosecution? A fine?A closure?When will you act? @StinkStopthe #stopthestink

@EnvAgency And in another message you said there’d be 59% more rain .....

Cable Pull Success! 🎉 🔌 Thanks to all 56(!) of you who came on Saturday and helped us pull our electrical cable from our grid connect point to our turbine house, underneath the Thames! Check out some of the images from the day #rdguk #caversham #berkshire #hydro #Sustainability https://t.co/Sn3WOkl0ns

@EnvAgency The population is soon to be in decline, though? Beyond that, we live in one of the most humid climates in Europe. Climate change is real, but water shortages and population boom aren't what England should be worried about.

urls.title: Corby man jailed and facing costs of £750,000 for waste crime
urls.description: A Northamptonshire man, who was jailed in January, after a decade of waste offences was ordered this week to pay £12,500 in costs and £140 in victim surcharge.

tweets.text:
Burning, burying and stockpiling waste without the correct permit is #illegal⚠️

A Northamptonshire man was fined £12,500 and jailed for breaching many environmental laws.

If you suspect any illegal waste activity call: 0800 80 70 60

More info: https://t.co/cksMMi14Qt https://t.co/lPH0BW1iJL

I can absolutely assure the @EnvAgency @EnvAgencySE that a large % of what we pulled out of 100 yards of the River Lea today was sanitary waste. I would be happy to take the two inspectors who allegedly saw no evidence of sewage/sanitary waste on a paddle down the river. https://t.co/i0UdMygQ97 https://t.co/D2nuqsiYP6

urls.title: [Withdrawn] Apply for a grant from the natural environment investment readiness fund
urls.description: Grants to prepare innovative nature projects in England that can attract private financial investment. Find out what the fund is for and how to apply.

This week is the last chance for your organisation to apply for a grant from the Natural Environment Investment Readiness Fund!

tweets.text:
In the UK, race numbers are non recyclable. 1000’s go to landfill every week. What a waste.

At our races, we don’t have them. Just one of the things we’re doing to make sporting events #sustainable 

#racingreinvented #trailrunning #ultrarunning #saynotoplastic #NoPlanetB https://t.co/1QHgl5iOzG

urls.title: HS2 begins work on UK’s longest rail viaduct
urls.description: HS2 began work this week on the UK’s longest railway bridge, with an expert team of ground engineers sinking the first of almost 300 piles that will form the foundations for the Colne Valley Viaduct.

tweets.text: Set low in the landscape, the Colne Valley Viaduct #design is inspired by a stone skipping across water. It also enables views and minimises the viaduct’s footprint. We're working with Affinity Water & @EnvAgency to monitor water quality during building: https://t.co/buIn6X4FVl https://t.co/DARevhgBDy

urls.title: Welcome! You are invited to join a webinar: Flood & Coast | Session 4: Innovative investment in FCERM. After registering, you will receive a confirmation email about joining the webinar.
urls.description: On this page you can register for the fourth out of four digital sessions of Flood & Coast. Registration deadline: 9 Apr 2021 Please note that the event will NOT be hosted in Zoom, we are only using this platform for registrations. A confirmation email including a calendar invite will be sent to you within 24 hours. Information about how to join the session will be sent by the 12th of April 2021. The price per session is £25.00 + VAT (total: £30.00) The payment system is supported by PayPal, but you don't need a PayPal account, you can simply use your debit or credit card to checkout. Click on "Pay and Register", then press the "Continue to PayPal" button. A new window will pop up asking you to either log into your PayPal account or to simply pay by debit or credit card (no PayPal account required, just click on "continue as guest" and add an email address where the receipt should be sent to). For any queries please email info@floodandcoast.com.

tweets.text:
The 2020 Digital Series will end with the fourth and final session on 'Innovative investment in FCERM' sponsored by @FedHermesIntl who have been at the forefront of investment and sustainability since 1983.

Book your place today: https://t.co/vA5y3K0JVv https://t.co/6nK8aQMmWV
